org.apache.ignite.streamer.index

Interface StreamerIndexProvider<E,K,V>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    StreamerIndexProviderMBean
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StreamerHashIndexProvider, StreamerIndexProviderAdapter, StreamerTreeIndexProvider

    public interface StreamerIndexProvider<E,K,V>
extends StreamerIndexProviderMBean
    Represents an actual instance of an index. Used by a StreamerWindow to perform event indexing.

    To configure index for a streamer window, use StreamerWindowAdapter.setIndexes(StreamerIndexProvider[]).

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Gets index name.
        Returns:
        Name of the index.

      • index

        StreamerIndex<E,K,V> index()
        Gets user view for this index. This view is a snapshot of a current index state. Once returned, it does not change over time.
        Returns:
        User view for this index.

      • initialize

        void initialize()
        Initializes the index.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets the index to an initial empty state.

      • dispose

        void dispose()
        Disposes the index.

      • add

        void add(StreamerIndexUpdateSync sync,
       E evt)
         throws IgniteException
        Adds an event to index.
        Parameters:
        sync - Index update synchronizer.
        evt - Event to add to an index.
        Throws:
        IgniteException - If failed to add event to an index.

      • remove

        void remove(StreamerIndexUpdateSync sync,
          E evt)
            throws IgniteException
        Removes an event from index.
        Parameters:
        sync - Index update synchronizer.
        evt - Event to remove from index.
        Throws:
        IgniteException - If failed to add event to an index.

      • getPolicy

        StreamerIndexPolicy getPolicy()
        Gets event indexing policy, which defines how events are tracked within an index.
        Returns:
        index policy.

      • isUnique

        boolean isUnique()
        Checks whether this index is unique or not. If it is, equal events are not allowed, which means that if a newly-added event is found to be equal to one of the already present events (Object.equals(Object) returns true), an exception is thrown.
        Returns:
        True for unique index.

      • endUpdate

        void endUpdate(StreamerIndexUpdateSync sync,
             E evt,
             boolean rollback,
             boolean rmv)
        Finalizes an update operation.
        Parameters:
        sync - Index update synchronizer.
        evt - Updated event.
        rollback - Rollback flag. If true, a rollback was made.
        rmv - Remove flag. If true, the event was removed from index.
